How does EITF 98-10 tie in with FAS 133? 
If FAS 133 says weather deals are not derivatives and don't fall 
        under 133, how should they be accounted for? 
FAS 133 applies to all entities, but not all companies need to 
        comply with it. Find out when and why compliance is optional. 
Find out why "fair value hedges" and "cash flow hedges" are 
        different, and which one can involve non-symmetric treatment of hedge 
        gains or losses. 
Learn how to properly document hedges, and to account for them as 
        they unfold. 
Learn how to test for effectiveness retrospectively and 
        prospectively, and which effectiveness method you should always choose.
        
See how 133 works in the context of real-life energy deals using 
        futures, swaps and options. 
Find out the two methods FAS allows for testing the effectiveness of 
        hedging with options, and which method you should always use. 
Learn what you must disclose about hedging and derivatives use, and 
        how often you must do it.










Anyone wanting or needing to 
      know how to make your shop and its derivative and hedging activities fully 
      FAS 133 compliant should attend this seminar. 








Attendees will receive and work with a 
      795-page guide to FAS Statement 133 and earn 8.0 hours of CPE 
      credit.
